cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northeast toward the Florida Big Bend, then forecast to sweep NE across GA/SC/NC and emerge near the Mid-Atlantic coast before turning eastward offshore
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Suwannee River–Mexico Beach)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Marineland FL northward to South Santee River SC (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Suwannee River to Mexico Beach FL (Hurricane); Anclote River to Destin FL (Tropical Storm)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. southeast and Mid-Atlantic coast from Florida Big Bend to New Jersey, including Virginia capes
weather_observation.wind: Potential sustained 35–45 mph with gusts 50 mph as the center passes near/over Hampton Roads late Saturday into early Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–3 ft possible along lower Chesapeake Bay and Atlantic frontage
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches possible with locally higher amounts, leading to flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands; short-term port-channel restrictions due to heavy rain and strong winds
